DataElement.preferredName: Human Papillomavirus-16 E7 Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Spot Assay Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Related to HPV- 16 E7 ELISPOT results value

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Human Papillomavirus-16 E7 Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Spot Assay Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A virus comprised of a protein coat (capsid) surrounding a circular, double-stranded DNA organized into coding and non-coding regions, which can induce skin and mucosal epithelial lesions. Human papillomavirus-16 (HPV16) has been directly linked to cervical cancer and is significantly associated with invasiveness. Progression from low- to high-grade neoplasia is often associated with the integration of the HPV16 genome into the host chromosome._Binds to and promotes degradation of p53 protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation._A highly sensitive immunoassay capable of detecting secreted materials from individual cells upon activation. If the material of interest is secreted in response to a particular stimulus, then the material will bind to a specific immobilized antibody. Binding is then verified and visualized by applying other antibodies that have been tagged in some way._The result of an action._Complexes with and inactivates Rb protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Human Papillomavirus-16 Papillomavirus Transforming Protein E7 Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Spot Assay
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A virus comprised of a protein coat (capsid) surrounding a circular, double-stranded DNA organized into coding and non-coding regions, which can induce skin and mucosal epithelial lesions. Human papillomavirus-16 (HPV16) has been directly linked to cervical cancer and is significantly associated with invasiveness. Progression from low- to high-grade neoplasia is often associated with the integration of the HPV16 genome into the host chromosome.:Complexes with and inactivates Rb protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation.:A highly sensitive immunoassay capable of detecting secreted materials from individual cells upon activation. If the material of interest is secreted in response to a particular stimulus, then the material will bind to a specific immobilized antibody. Binding is then verified and visualized by applying other antibodies that have been tagged in some way.

Concepts.definition: A virus comprised of a protein coat (capsid) surrounding a circular, double-stranded DNA organized into coding and non-coding regions, which can induce skin and mucosal epithelial lesions. Human papillomavirus-16 (HPV16) has been directly linked to cervical cancer and is significantly associated with invasiveness. Progression from low- to high-grade neoplasia is often associated with the integration of the HPV16 genome into the host chromosome.
Complexes with and inactivates Rb protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation.

A highly sensitive immunoassay capable of detecting secreted materials from individual cells upon activation. If the material of interest is secreted in response to a particular stimulus, then the material will bind to a specific immobilized antibody. Binding is then verified and visualized by applying other antibodies that have been tagged in some way.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
